csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// On Balance Volume (OBV)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Relates price and volume to identify buying or selling pressure.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>If Close > PrevClose: Add Volume</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>If Close < PrevClose: Subtract Volume</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>If Close == PrevClose: No Change</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class OnBalanceVolume
18 {
19 public List<long> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
22 {
23 Values.Clear();
24 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
25 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
26​
27 long currentObv = 0;
28 Values.Add(currentObv);
29​
30 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
31 {
32 decimal close = candleList[i].Close;
33 decimal prevClose = candleList[i - 1].Close;
34 long volume = candleList[i].Volume;
35​
36 if (close > prevClose)
37 currentObv += volume;
38 else if (close < prevClose)
39 currentObv -= volume;
40​
41 Values.Add(currentObv);
42 }
43 }
44​
45 public static List<long> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
46 {
47 var obv = new OnBalanceVolume();
48 obv.Calculate(candles);
49 return obv.Values;
50 }
51 }
52}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (OnBalanceVolume)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// On Balance Volume (OBV) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. What is OBV?
13// [Creator] Joe Granville (1963)
14// [Core Idea] "Volume precedes price."
15// [Purpose] Track cumulative buying/selling pressure through volume.
16//
17// 2. The Logic
18// [Simple Rule]
19// If Close[today] > Close[yesterday] → ADD today's volume (buyers winning)
20// If Close[today] < Close[yesterday] → SUBTRACT today's volume (sellers winning)
21// If Close[today] = Close[yesterday] → Volume is NEUTRAL (no change)
22//
23// 3. Visual Understanding
24//
25// [OBV Accumulation]
26//
27// Day |Close|Volume| Change | OBV
28// ----|-----|------|--------|--------
29// 1 | 100 | 1000 | - | 0 (initial)
30// 2 | 102 | 1500 | ↑ | +1500
31// 3 | 101 | 1200 | ↓ | +300 (1500 - 1200)
32// 4 | 101 | 800 | = | +300 (unchanged)
33// 5 | 103 | 2000 | ↑ | +2300 (300 + 2000)
34//
35// 4. Signal Interpretation
36//
37// | Price Trend | OBV Trend | Interpretation |
38// |-------------|-----------|-------------------------------|
39// | ↑ | ↑ | Healthy uptrend (confirmed) |
40// | ↑ | ↓ | Bearish divergence (warning!) |
41// | ↓ | ↓ | Healthy downtrend (confirmed) |
42// | ↓ | ↑ | Bullish divergence (reversal?)|
43//
44// 5. Divergence Analysis
45//
46// [Visual: Bearish Divergence]
47//
48// Price: Making HIGHER highs
49// ╱╲
50// ╱ ╲
51// ╱╲ ╱ ─ ─ ─ → New High
52// ╱ ╲╱
53//
54// OBV: Making LOWER highs (volume not confirming)
55// ╱╲
56// ╱ ╲
57// ╲ ─ ─ ─ → Lower High (bearish!)
58// ╲
59//
60// ⚠️ Buyers are losing conviction despite higher prices.
61//
62// =============================================================================
63​
64using System;
65using System.Collections.Generic;
66​
67namespace TechnicalIndicators
68{
69 // =============================================================================
70 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
71 // =============================================================================
72 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
73​
74 // =============================================================================
75 // Logic Explanation: OnBalanceVolume Class
76 // =============================================================================
77 public class OnBalanceVolume
78 {
79 // -------------------------------------------------------------
80 // Logic Explanation: Output List
81 //
82 // [Why long?] Volume can accumulate to very large numbers.
83 // Using 'long' prevents overflow.
84 // -------------------------------------------------------------
85 public List<long> Values { get; } = new();
86​
87 // =============================================================================
88 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
89 // =============================================================================
90 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
91 {
92 // -------------------------------------------------------------
93 // Step 1: Cleanup & Setup
94 // -------------------------------------------------------------
95 Values.Clear();
96 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
97 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
98​
99 // -------------------------------------------------------------
100 // Step 2: Initialize OBV
101 //
102 // [Note] First bar has OBV = 0 (starting point).
103 // The absolute value doesn't matter; the TREND does.
104 // -------------------------------------------------------------
105 long currentObv = 0;
106 Values.Add(currentObv);
107​
108 // -------------------------------------------------------------
109 // Step 3: Main Loop
110 //
111 // [Visual: Decision Tree]
112 //
113 // Close[i] vs Close[i-1]
114 // │
115 // ┌────────────────┼────────────────┐
116 // │ │ │
117 // Close↑ Close= Close↓
118 // │ │ │
119 // OBV += Vol OBV unchanged OBV -= Vol
120 // (Buyers win) (Neutral) (Sellers win)
121 // -------------------------------------------------------------
122 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
123 {
124 decimal close = candleList[i].Close;
125 decimal prevClose = candleList[i - 1].Close;
126 long volume = candleList[i].Volume;
127​
128 // [Condition 1] Price went UP → Add volume (buying pressure)
129 if (close > prevClose)
130 {
131 currentObv += volume;
132 }
133 // [Condition 2] Price went DOWN → Subtract volume (selling pressure)
134 else if (close < prevClose)
135 {
136 currentObv -= volume;
137 }
138 // [Condition 3] Price unchanged → OBV stays the same
139 // (implicit else - no action needed)
140​
141 Values.Add(currentObv);
142 }
143 }
144​
145 // =============================================================================
146 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
147 //
148 // [IPO Block]
149 // Input: IEnumerable<CandleData>
150 // Process: Creates instance, runs Calculate()
151 // Output: List of OBV values (cumulative volume)
152 // =============================================================================
153 public static List<long> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
154 {
155 var obv = new OnBalanceVolume();
156 obv.Calculate(candles);
157 return obv.Values;
158 }
159 }
160}
python_simple:
1class OnBalanceVolume:
2 """
3 On Balance Volume (OBV)
4 Cumulative volume flow.
5 """
6 def __init__(self):
7 self.values = []
8​
9 def calculate(self, candles):
10 self.values.clear()
11 if len(candles) == 0: return
12​
13 current_obv = 0
14 self.values.append(current_obv)
15​
16 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
17 close_curr = float(candles[i]['close'])
18 close_prev = float(candles[i-1]['close'])
19 vol = int(candles[i]['volume'])
20​
21 if close_curr > close_prev:
22 current_obv += vol
23 elif close_curr < close_prev:
24 current_obv -= vol
25
26 self.values.append(current_obv)
27​
28def calculate(candles):
29 obv = OnBalanceVolume()
30 obv.calculate(candles)
31 return obv.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (On Balance Volume)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# On Balance Volume (OBV). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Volume Flow
11# - Conceptualizes volume as a "force" that pushes price.
12# - "Volume precedes Price": Significant changes in OBV often happen *before*
13# significant price trend changes.
14#
15# 2. Cumulative Addition/Subtraction
16# - Up Day (Close > PrevClose): Add Volume to Total.
17# - Down Day (Close < PrevClose): Subtract Volume from Total.
18# - Neutral Day (Close == PrevClose): No change.
19#
20# =============================================================================
21​
22# -------------------------------------------------------------
23# Type-Level Explanation: OnBalanceVolume (class)
24#
25# [Why] Tracks the cumulative flow of volume.
26# [What] A momentum indicator using volume.
27# [How] Adds volume to a running total on up days (Close > Previous Close) and subtracts it on down days, creating a cumulative trend of buying and selling pressure.
28# [Who] Developed by Joe Granville (1963).
29# [Where] Heap.
30# -------------------------------------------------------------
31class OnBalanceVolume:
32
33 # -------------------------------------------------------------
34 # Variable Definition: values
35 # [Role] Stores the running total of volume flow.
36 # [Type] List[float]. Can be positive or negative.
37 # -------------------------------------------------------------
38 # values = []
39​
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # Constructor: __init__
42 # [Why] Initialize storage.
43 # -------------------------------------------------------------
44 def __init__(self):
45 self.values = []
46​
47 # =============================================================================
48 # IPO: calculate
49 # =============================================================================
50 #
51 # [Input]
52 # - candles: List[dict]
53 #
54 # [Process]
55 # 1. Start accumulation at 0.
56 # 2. Iterate through bars.
57 # 3. Check Price Direction vs previous bar.
58 # 4. Modify Running Total (OBV) by current Volume.
59 #
60 # [Output]
61 # - None (Populates 'values' list).
62 # =============================================================================
63 def calculate(self, candles):
64
65 # -------------------------------------------------------------
66 # Logic Step 1: Reset
67 # [Why] Clear previous calculation results.
68 # -------------------------------------------------------------
69 self.values.clear()
70
71 if len(candles) == 0:
72 return
73​
74 # -------------------------------------------------------------
75 # Logic Step 2: Initialization
76 #
77 # [Why]
78 # We start the accumulator at 0. The first bar has no previous data
79 # to compare against, so its contribution is usually treated as 0
80 # or just the starting point of the series.
81 # -------------------------------------------------------------
82 current_obv = 0.0
83 self.values.append(current_obv)
84​
85 # -------------------------------------------------------------
86 # Logic Step 3: Main Loop
87 #
88 # [Visual]
89 # i=1: Close(105) > Prev(100) -> OBV += Vol(50) -> OBV=50
90 # i=2: Close(102) < Prev(105) -> OBV -= Vol(20) -> OBV=30
91 # i=3: Close(102) == Prev(102)-> OBV += 0 -> OBV=30
92 # -------------------------------------------------------------
93 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
94 close = candles[i]['close']
95 prev_close = candles[i - 1]['close']
96 volume = candles[i]['volume']
97
98 # -------------------------------------------------------------
99 # Logic Step 3.1: Direction Check
100 #
101 # [Decision]
102 # Did price close higher, lower, or equal?
103 # -------------------------------------------------------------
104 if close > prev_close:
105 # [Action] Up Day: Buying Pressure
106 current_obv += volume
107
108 elif close < prev_close:
109 # [Action] Down Day: Selling Pressure
110 current_obv -= volume
111
112 else:
113 # [Action] Doji/Flat: Neutral
114 # current_obv remains unchanged
115 pass
116
117 # Logic Step 3.2: Store
118 self.values.append(current_obv)
119​
120# =============================================================================
121# Static Wrapper Function
122# =============================================================================
123#
124# [Why] Functional API.
125# [Usage] obv_values = calculate(candles)
126# =============================================================================
127def calculate(candles):
128 # 1. Instantiation
129 instance = OnBalanceVolume()
130
131 # 2. Execution
132 instance.calculate(candles)
133
134 # 3. Extraction
135 return instance.values
